resources.string: Buttons are fundamental components that allow the user to trigger a defined action. There are five types of buttons
The Card composable acts as a Material Design container for your UI. Cards typically present a single coherent piece of content
The Chip component is a compact, interactive UI element. It represents complex entities like a contact or tag, often with an icon and label. It can be checkable, dismissible, or clickable.
Bottom sheets are used to show secondary content and actions on a mobile screen anchored to the bottom of the screen.
The Dialog component displays pop up messages or requests user input on a layer above the main app content. It creates an interruptive UI experience to capture user attention
Dividers are thin lines that separate items in lists or other containers. You can implement dividers in your app using the HorizontalDivider and VerticalDivider composables
Lazy lists compose provides a set of components which only compose and lay out items which are visible in the component\'s viewportThese components include LazyColumn and LazyRow
A Lazy grid will display its items in a vertically scrollable container, spanned across multiple columns,
Progress indicators visually surface the status of an operation. They use motion to bring to the user\'s attention how near completion the process is, such as loading or processing data.
In Material Design, a scaffold is a fundamental structure that provides a standardized platform for complex user interfaces. It holds app bars and floating action buttons.

The Slider composable allows users to make selections from a range of values. You might use a slider to let the user do the following: Adjust settings that use a range of values, such as volume, and brightness
The Switch component allows users to toggle between two states: checked and unchecked. In your app you may use a switch to let the user to do one of the following: Toggle a setting on or off
TextField allows users to enter and modify text. This page describes how you can implement TextField , style TextField input, and configure other TextField options
By clicking the below button you get the custom ui of the login page for the jetpack compose
You can navigate from one screen to another screen with or without data
